author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian story about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control its citizens. The protagonist, Winston Smith, secretly longs for freedom and truth.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins, a comfortable hobbit, is swept into an unexpected adventure with thirteen dwarves and the wizard Gandalf to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from the dragon Smaug.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates the complex world of 19th-century English society, where marriage and social status dominate daily life.

title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
author: Agatha Christie
summary: In the quiet village of King's Abbot, the wealthy Roger Ackroyd is found dead in his study, and everyone becomes a suspect.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
summary: On the desert planet Arrakis, young Paul Atreides becomes embroiled in a struggle for control of the universe's most valuable substance.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
summary: Sixteen-year-old Hazel Grace Lancaster, living with terminal cancer, meets Augustus Waters at a cancer support group.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
summary: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist teams up with the enigmatic hacker Lisbeth Salander to investigate a decades-old disappearance.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd, dreams of finding treasure in the Egyptian pyramids and embarks on a transformative journey.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
summary: When Amy Dunne disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary, her husband Nick becomes the prime suspect in what appears to be her murder.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
summary: In the totalitarian Republic of Gilead, fertile women called Handmaids are forced into reproductive servitude for the ruling class.
